1.text: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is a brawler, and whoever is led astray by them is not wise.

2.text: The terror of a king is like the roar of a lion; whoever provokes him forfeits his own life.

3.text: It is honorable for a man to resolve a dispute, but any fool will quarrel.

4.text: The slacker does not plow in season; at harvest time he looks, but nothing is there.

5.text: The intentions of a man’s heart are deep waters, but a man of understanding draws them out.

6.text: Many a man proclaims his loving devotion, but who can find a trustworthy man?

7.text: The righteous man walks with integrity; blessed are his children after him.

8.text: A king who sits on a throne to judge sifts out all evil with his eyes.

9.text: Who can say, “I have kept my heart pure; I am cleansed from my sin”?

10.text: Differing weights and unequal measures—both are detestable to the LORD.

11.text: Even a young man is known by his actions—whether his conduct is pure and upright.

12.text: Ears that hear and eyes that see—the LORD has made them both.

13.text: Do not love sleep, or you will grow poor; open your eyes, and you will have plenty of food.

14.text: “Worthless, worthless!” says the buyer, but on the way out, he gloats.

15.text: There is an abundance of gold and rubies, but lips of knowledge are a rare treasure.

16.text: Take the garment of the one who posts security for a stranger; get collateral if it is for a foreigner.

17.text: Food gained by fraud is sweet to a man, but later his mouth is full of gravel.

18.text: Set plans by consultation, and wage war under sound guidance.

19.text: He who reveals secrets is a constant gossip; avoid the one who babbles with his lips.

20.text: Whoever curses his father or mother, his lamp will be extinguished in deepest darkness.

21.text: An inheritance gained quickly will not be blessed in the end.

22.text: Do not say, “I will avenge this evil!” Wait on the LORD, and He will save you.

23.text: Unequal weights are detestable to the LORD, and dishonest scales are no good.

24.text: A man’s steps are from the LORD, so how can anyone understand his own way?

25.text: It is a trap for a man to dedicate something rashly, only later to reconsider his vows.

26.text: A wise king separates out the wicked and drives the threshing wheel over them.

27.text: The spirit of a man is the lamp of the LORD, searching out his inmost being.

28.text: Loving devotion and faithfulness preserve a king; by these he maintains his throne.

29.text: The glory of young men is their strength, and gray hair is the splendor of the old.

30.text: Lashes and wounds scour evil, and beatings cleanse the inmost parts.
